title: Ticket #5055: Cleanup blahp shell usage
description:
There are several anti-patterns in the blah code. For example, in tempfile usage: 

          rand=`od -A n -t xC -N 6 /dev/urandom`
          bls_tmp_name=bl_${rand// /}
          bls_tmp_file="$bls_opt_temp_dir/$bls_tmp_name"
          `touch $bls_tmp_file;chmod 600 $bls_tmp_file`

or 

                datefile=/tmp/blahdate_$RANDOM$RANDOM$RANDOM
                touch $datefile;chmod 600 $datefile

There are probably other things someone with deep knowledge of shell scripting can pick out. We should have a light review of these scripts.
